discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
examples of factors:
- Password
- PIN
- One-time password
- Software token
- Hardware token
- Biometrics
- Specific location
Why is it not C?

comments.content:
C has both possession factors only. D has possession and knowledge factors
And the question is asking for multifactor authentication.
Got it?
Because hardware token and smartphone are possession factors(something u have). And smart card is possession factor(something u have) and PIN is knowledge factor(something u know).ðŸ˜ƒ

It's not C because those are two "Things you have(posess)".
It's D because the 2 factors are "something you have"(security card) and "something you know"(the pin # for the security card)

All of the other answers are single factor as well.

questions.question_text: Which of the following language types would a web developer MOST likely use to create a website?

A developer is creating specific step-by-step instructions/procedures and conditional statements that will be used by a computer program to solve problems.
Which of the following is being developed?

discussion.content: Algorithm is correct. You can use a pseudocode/flowchart do describe an algorithm.

Selected Answer: A
A. Algorithm
An algorithm is a set of step-by-step instructions and conditional statements that a computer program follows to solve a problem. It serves as the foundation for writing software, guiding how data is processed and decisions are made.
What is the correct answer?

Selected Answer: A
algorithm:   Set of rules for solving a problem in a given number of steps
It's D

comments.content: "instructions" made it more difficult that it needs to be. Think of pseudocode as a description of the code in a more readable manner. It would be D

discussion.content: I think its "C" Please check it.
yes i thought D
Isn't it Flowchart
Bad question. Algorithm is pseudocode. Very similar.

Access point allows devices to connect to the internet through wireless
Devices (Wireless) -> Access Point -> Router -> Modem.
Access point and Router can be combined as one device which is common these days.
D.Access point.

Selected Answer: D
D.Access point.

Selected Answer: D
Access point:
An access point is any point that allows a user on to a network.
D) Access point
A. Modem

questions.question_text: Which of the following allows wireless devices to communicate to a wired network?
In which of the following situations should there be come expectation of privacy?

choices.C: Posting a comment on a video sharing site
choices.B: Submitting personal information on a school enrollment site
choices.A: Posting a comment on a friend's social media page
choices.D: Sending email and pictures to a close relative

comments.content: True but it says the BEST so it would be the school one
The option includes email to close relative which is why I believe the school fits best. But you are correct

discussion.content: According to the criminal code, and case law, there is an expectation of privacy when sending emails as well.
